body_html:
As mentioned earlier in the thread, we're discouraging new uses of the C++ API through SWIG. Any language bindings should now go through the C API, which is pretty close to feature-complete with the C++ API:
https://cs.corp.google.com/piper///depot/google3/third_party/tensorflow/c/c_api.h

You can see an in-progress binding that uses the C API here:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/go
body_text:
As mentioned earlier in the thread, we're discouraging new uses of the C++ API through SWIG. Any language bindings should now go through the C API, which is pretty close to feature-complete with the C++ API:
https://cs.corp.google.com/piper///depot/google3/third_party/tensorflow/c/c_api.h
You can see an in-progress binding that uses the C API here:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/go
body:
As mentioned earlier in the thread, we're discouraging new uses of the C++ API through SWIG. Any language bindings should now go through the C API, which is pretty close to feature-complete with the C++ API:
https://cs.corp.google.com/piper///depot/google3/third_party/tensorflow/c/c_api.h

You can see an in-progress binding that uses the C API here:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/go
